com.qoppa.pdf

Class TextPosition

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qoppa.pdf.TextPosition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TextSelection
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TextPositionWithContext

    public class TextPosition
extends java.lang.Object
implements TextSelection
    Object that holds information about the location of a text string in a PDF file. This information is returned by the library when text information is needed by the host application. The information includes the text position, its angle and its list of enclosing "quadrilaterals". Each quadrilateral is an array of four points that enclose some portion of the text. Typically, a TextPosition for a single word, or a contiguous list of words on a single line will have a single quadrilateral. But if the text is not contiguous or spans multiple lines, then multiple quadrilaterals are required.
    Author:
    Qoppa Software

      • getPageNumber

        public int getPageNumber()
        Indicates on which page of the document the TextPosition's text is located.
        Returns:
        The page number of the page the TextPosition's text is located on.

      • getEnclosingShape

        public java.awt.Shape getEnclosingShape()
        Deprecated. This method is redundant. Replaced by get by getViewSelectionShape().
        Returns a shape that encloses the text on the page. The shape's coordinate system is in 'display' coordinates: The origin of the coordinates are page.getCropBox().getX() and page.getCropBox().getY().
        Returns:
        The shape that encloses the text on the screen

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Returns the text string.
        Specified by:
        getText in interface TextSelection
        Returns:
        The text.

      • getQuadrilateral

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D[] getQuadrilateral()
        Deprecated. replaced by getViewQuadrilaterals().
        Returns a quadrilateral with the four corners for this text string. The coordinates of the quadrilateral is in 'display' coordinates: The origin of the coordinates are page.getCropBox().getX() and page.getCropBox().getY().
        Returns:
        An array of 4 Point2D object. The points in can be connected by lines in the array order to form the quadrilateral enclosing the text.

      • getViewQuadrilateral

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D[] getViewQuadrilateral()
        Deprecated. replaced by getViewQuadrilaterals().
        Returns a quadrilateral with the four corners for this text string. The coordinates of the quadrilateral is in 'display' coordinates: The origin of the coordinates are page.getCropBox().getX() and page.getCropBox().getY().
        Returns:
        An array of 4 Point2D object. The points in can be connected by lines in the array order to form the quadrilateral enclosing the text. Note: A TextPosition may be enclosed by a list of a quadrilaterals and this method only returns the first quadrilateral in the list.

      • getPDFQuadrilateral

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D[] getPDFQuadrilateral()
        Deprecated. replaced by getPDFQuadrilaterals().
        Returns a quadrilateral with the four corners for this text string. The coordinates of the quadrilateral is Media box coordinates.
        Returns:
        An array of 4 Point2D object. The points in can be connected by lines in the array order to form the quadrilateral enclosing the text. Note: A TextPosition may be enclosed by a list of a quadrilaterals and this method only returns the first quadrilateral in the list.

      • getAngle

        public double getAngle()
        Returns the angle that this text is displayed at on the page.
        Returns:
        The angle of the text in radians and in Media box coordinate space.

      • getQuadrilaterals

        public java.util.Vector<java.awt.geom.Point2D[]> getQuadrilaterals()
        Deprecated. replaced with getViewQuadrilaterals().
        Returns a list of quadrilaterals that will enclose the text elements in this object. The coordinates of the list of quadrilaterals is in 'display' coordinates: The origin of the coordinates are page.getCropBox().getX() and page.getCropBox().getY(). This method fulfills the TextSelection interface and will always return a Vector with a single element.
        Specified by:
        getQuadrilaterals in interface TextSelection
        Returns:
        A list of one quadrilateral - the four around the text

      • getViewQuadrilaterals

        public java.util.Vector<java.awt.geom.Point2D[]> getViewQuadrilaterals()
        Returns a list of quadrilaterals that will enclose the text elements in this object. The coordinates of the list of quadrilaterals is in 'display' coordinates: The origin of the coordinates are page.getCropBox().getX() and page.getCropBox().getY(). This method fulfills the TextSelection interface and will always return a Vector with a single element.
        Specified by:
        getViewQuadrilaterals in interface TextSelection
        Returns:
        A list of one quadrilateral - the four around the text In general you probably would use getPDFQuadrilaterals() rather than this method as quadrilaterals are typically used in PDF/"Media box" coordinate space.

      • getPDFQuadrilaterals

        public java.util.Vector<java.awt.geom.Point2D[]> getPDFQuadrilaterals()
        Returns a list of quadrilaterals that will enclose the text elements in this object. The coordinates of the list of quadrilaterals is in Media box coordinates. This method fulfills the TextSelection interface and will always return a Vector with a single element.
        Specified by:
        getPDFQuadrilaterals in interface TextSelection
        Returns:
        A list of one quadrilateral - the four around the text Note: When creating annotations that require quadrilaterals such as text highlighting or redactions, this is the method you should use as they operate in "Media box", AKA PDF space, coordinates.

      • getSelectionShape

        @Deprecated
public java.awt.Shape getSelectionShape()
        Deprecated. replaced by getViewSelectionShape().
        Returns a shape that encloses the text on the page. The shape's coordinate system is in 'display' coordinates: The origin of the coordinates are page.getCropBox().getX() and page.getCropBox().getY(). This method fulfills the TextSelection interface.
        Specified by:
        getSelectionShape in interface TextSelection
        Returns:
        The shape that encloses the text on the screen

      • getPDFSelectionShape

        public java.awt.Shape getPDFSelectionShape()
        Returns the entire shape that encloses all different word groups in this selection. The shape's coordinate system is in MediaBox coordinates. The coordinate space of this shape does not compensate for a cropbox or page rotation. For example, if the cropbox's origin is at pt (50,50), then pt (25, 25) is outside of the viewable/displayable area.
        Specified by:
        getPDFSelectionShape in interface TextSelection
        Returns:
        A Shape, possibly composed of a number of subshapes, that holds all the selection area.

      • getViewSelectionShape

        public java.awt.Shape getViewSelectionShape()
        Returns the entire shape that encloses all different word groups in this selection. The shape's coordinate system is in 'display' coordinates: The origin of the coordinates are page.getCropBox().getX() and page.getCropBox().getY().
        Specified by:
        getViewSelectionShape in interface TextSelection
        Returns:
        A Shape, possibly composed of a number of subshapes, that holds all the selection area. The coordinate space of this shape differs from getPDFSelectionShape() by applying a transform that takes into account the cropbox of the document and the page's rotation. This coordinate space can be useful when 'display' or 'view' coordinates are needed.
